Reason: The 'depths.reflection' configuration option in the 'sunflow' software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value significantly impacts the rendering performance of the system. Reflection depth directly affects the quality and complexity of rendered images, leading to variations in execution time and memory consumption. Higher reflection depths require more computational resources and can slow down the rendering process, while lower depths may result in lower quality images. Therefore, any change in the 'depths.reflection' configuration can have a notable impact on system performance.
